summary: This document is an email chain from October 2019 between attorney Sigrid McCawley and an unnamed recipient, discussing efforts to secure trauma therapy and victim compensation for a client who is a victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The email references the client's significant trauma, loss of livelihood, and the need for assistance.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: She is a partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, advocating for her client to receive trauma therapy and victim compensation. She describes the client's severe trauma and financial losses resulting from Epstein's conduct.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the individual whose conduct caused significant trauma and ruined the livelihood of the attorney's client.

connections.description: McCawley is representing a victim of Epstein, seeking compensation and therapy for the harm he caused.

events.title: Email request for victim assistance
events.description: Sigrid McCawley emails an unnamed recipient seeking trauma therapy and financial aid for her client, an Epstein victim.

events.title: Follow-up on victim assistance options
events.description: An unnamed recipient replies to Sigrid McCawley, reporting progress in finding trauma-focused therapists through county victim assistance and providing a link to the New York State Crime Victims Compensation application.

keyFacts: An attorney is actively seeking trauma therapy and victim compensation for a client who is a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.
The victim suffered significant trauma and loss of livelihood as a result of Epstein's conduct.
The correspondence involves coordination with county victim assistance programs and references the New York State Crime Victims Compensation program.
The email chain demonstrates ongoing efforts in 2019 to provide support to Epstein's victims following his arrest and death.
